newsitem.title: USA: CBOT wheat turns mixed, corn/soy slide hits market.
newsitem.headline: CBOT wheat turns mixed, corn/soy slide hits market.

text.p: CBOT soft red winter wheat futures turned mixed in late dealings with a slide in corn and soybeans hitting the market and pressuring nearby contracts lower, traders said.
Wheat had traded higher most of the session on support from the export sector.
USDA early Thursday said U.S. net export sales of wheat during the week ended July 10 totalled 586,900 tonnes, well above expectations for 250,000 to 450,000 tonnes.
Traders also said the CBOT markets, including wheat, were expected to remain volatile and were seeking direction amid conflicting weather forecasts.
"It may be Monday before we know where we're going from here. Monday will be a major swing day," a trader said.
Commercial selling tied to hedge selling limited gains, the traders said.
Continental Grain sold two million bushels of September and Cargill Inc sold one-half million bushels of September, traders said.
At 1308 CDT, CBOT soft red winter wheat was two cents lower to 3-3/4 higher, with July down two at $3.23. September was up one-half cent at $3.32.
